src:
Cs reivindica la seva catalanitat enfront d'un PP i un PSOE que "deixaran abandonada" Catalunya
Inés Arrimadas demana el vot des d'un bar a l'Hospitalet de Llobregat i crida els ciutadans a "vèncer la por" i "les enquestes"

03 Nov 2019, 13:08

La candidata de Ciutadans per Barcelona al Congrés, Inés Arrimadas, ha comparegut aquest diumenge davant els seus en el bar Can Galan a l'Hospitalet de Llobregat per recordar els orígens del partit a Catalunya. "Quan vam néixer fèiem les reunions en bars com aquest", explicava amb nostàlgia un càrrec del partit, que des del seu naixement ha crescut a un ritme molt ràpid però ara s'enfronta a l'amenaça de perdre molta força al Congrés ( les últimes enquestes publicades li donen menys de 20 escons). Des d'una petita tarima i amb una cervesa sense alcohol per brindar, Arrimadas ha reivindicat Ciutadans com l'única opció constitucionalista nascuda sobre el terreny per lluitar contra el Procés davant un PP i un PSOE que "no saben" realment què implica el moviment independentista i tornaran a "deixar abandonats" els votants. 
"No ho saben o no ho volen saber", ha afirmat: "No ens sabran defensar com sabem nosaltres, perquè nosaltres hem nascut aquí a Catalunya". "Jo segueixo vivint aquí a Barcelona per molt que em vulguin fer fora perquè m'he presentat al Congrés", ha dit l'exlíder de Cs a Catalunya, que des que va marxar ha rebut crítiques tant del PP com per part de veus internes del partit que han qüestionat que no exercís un paper més actiu com a cap de l'oposició a Catalunya.
No obstant, en l'acte d'avui Arrimadas ha rebut l'escalf dels càrrecs catalans. La candidata ha hagut de corregir el públic, que li deia "Presidenta, presidenta!": "Albert Rivera serà president", ha insistit ella. "El PP i el PSOE han governat amb majories absolutes i ens han deixat abandonats", ha etzibat la també portaveu al Congrés: "Tornaran a fer el mateix si nosaltres no hi som". "El separatisme també sap què passa quan governa el PP fins i tot amb majoria absoluta, molt blabla a l'oposició i zero al govern espanyol", ha assegurat Arrimadas contra el president dels conservadors, Pablo Casado, que va fort a les enquestes. "No volen venir aquí, els fa mandra, saben com de difícil és", ha recalcat, i ha tret pit de Cs com un partit que "no ha de venir". "Som d'aquí i us defensarem", ha dit. 
Crítica amb TV3
En la mateixa línia argumental, Arrimadas ha fet una descripció de tot el que considera ofenses de l'independentisme en la vida diària dels catalans. "La gent de Madrid del PP i del PSOE et diuen: «Ja està més tranquil·la la cosa, no?»", ha dit amb sornegueria la candidata, en referència al fet que ara hi ha menys aldarulls. "Tranquil·la? Pregunta-ho als pares que reben cada dia e-mails o notetes dient que cal secundar la vaga, pregunta-ho als valents de S'ha Acabat que s'han de trencar la cara per entrar a classe", ha asseverat. 
En el mateix sentit, ha estat molt crítica amb la televisió pública catalana. "No es cansen de donar-los els diners a Toni Soler i a Empar Moliner", ha lamentat i els assistents li han respost al crit de "Fora, fora!". "Us insulten cada dia", ha insistit Arrimadas, que ha recordat la polèmica que hi va haver fa uns dies al programa Està passant de Toni Soler, que en un gag va comparar els Mossos amb gossos. "Van dir «putos gossos de merda» als Mossos d'Esquadra, i molts d'aquests mossos són fills d'aquests barris treballadors", ha recalcat Arrimadas, que ha insistit que els agents "tenen més dignitat que tots els Tonis Solers i les Empars Moliners junts". "Vosaltres sabeu com nosaltres el que passa cada dia a Catalunya", ha etzibat. 
Tot i que Cs competeix també amb Vox (especialment en el marc del discurs antiindependentista), Arrimadas no ha esmentat en cap moment el partit d'extrema dreta. S'hi ha referit indirectament, quan ha reivindicat el vot de Cs perquè "els nacionalistes deixin de decidir per tots els espanyols", els "corruptes" pels "treballadors" i "els extremistes" pels "moderats". "Hem de vèncer les enquestes, hem de vèncer la por!", ha recalcat.
Edmundo Bal: "Sou els meus germans"
Arrimadas ha fet la seva intervenció acompanyada del número quatre a les llistes per Madrid, l'exadvocat de l'Estat Edmundo Bal, i de la seva successora com a líder a Catalunya, Lorena Roldán. Bal ha fet una encesa defensa del fet que els líders independentistes empresonats han comès, al seu entendre, un delicte de "rebel·lió". De fet, la seva defensa d'aquesta tesi el va portar a ser cessat del seu lloc com a advocat de l'Estat per pèrdua de confiança de l'executiu socialista, i la seva successora en el càrrec, Rosa María Seoane, va aposta per la sedició, que finalment ha estat el delicte pel qual els presos polítics han estat condemnats. "Em van cessar perquè em vaig negar a treure la violència de l'escrit d'acusació, la violència que vau patir vosaltres, i per això em vaig convertir en la vostra veu a Madrid", ha dit: "Perquè em vaig negar a firmar aquest escrit, ara som germans".
text:
Cs claims its catalanity against a PP and a PSOE that "will leave abandoned" Catalonia
Inés Arrimadas calls for the vote from a bar in Hospitalet de Llobregat and calls on the citizens to "overcome fear" and "the polls"

03 Nov 2019, 13:08

The candidate of Citizens for Barcelona in the Congress, Inés Arrimadas, appeared on Sunday at the Can Galan bar in Hospitalet de Llobregat to remember the origins of the party in Catalonia. "When we were born, we made meetings in bars like this," he had a nostalgia for a party charge, which from the beginning has grown at a fast pace but now faces the threat of losing power in the Congress (the Latest published surveys give you less than 20 seats.) From a small platform and a beer without alcohol to provide, Arrimadas has claimed Citizens as the only constitutionalist option born on the ground to fight against the Process before a PP and a PSOE who "do not know" what the movement really implies Independent and will return to "leave left" the voters.
"They do not know or do not want to know," he said: "They will not know how to defend us as we know, because we have been born here in Catalonia." "I am still living here in Barcelona as much as they want to do me out because I have been presented to the Congress," said Cs's former leader in Catalonia, who since leaving has received criticism from the PP as well as from internal voices of the party that have questioned that it did not play a more active role as leader of the opposition in Catalonia.
However, in the act of today Arrimadas has received the warmth of the Catalan offices. The candidate had to correct the audience, who said "President, president!": "Albert Rivera will be president," she insisted. "The PP and the PSOE have governed with absolute majorities and left us abandoned," said the spokesman for the Congress: "They will do the same again if we are not there." "Separatism also knows what happens when the PP governs even with absolute majority, very blabla to the opposition and zero to the Spanish government," Arrimadas told the conservative president, Pablo Casado, who goes strong in the polls. "They do not want to come here, it makes them laziness, they know how difficult it is," he emphasized, and he has taken Cs as a party that "should not come". "We are here and we will defend you," he said.
Review with TV3
Along the same line, Arrimadas has described all of what he considers as an offense of independentism in the daily life of Catalans. "The people of Madrid of the PP and the PSOE say to you:" The thing is more relaxed, is not it? ", The candidate said candidly, referring to the fact that there are now fewer disturbances. "Quiet? Ask the parents who receive e-mails or notices every day saying that the strike must be seconded, ask the brave of the Finished that they must break the face to enter the class," has asserted
In the same sense, it has been very critical with Catalan public television. "Do not be tired of donating money to Toni Soler and Empar Moliner," he regretted and the attendees responded to the shout of "Out, outside!". "They insult you every day," insisted Arrimadas, who recalled the controversy that was there a few days ago in the program It's happening of Toni Soler, who in a gag compared Mossos with dogs. "They said" fucking crap dogs "to the Mossos d'Esquadra, and many of these minors are the children of these working districts," emphasized Arrimadas, who insisted that agents "have more dignity than all Tonis Solers and the Empars Moliners together ". "You know how we spend what goes on every day in Catalonia," he said.
Although Cs also competes with Vox (especially in the context of anti-independent discourse), Arrimadas has never mentioned the far right party at any time. He has referred indirectly, when he has vindicated the vote of Cs because "nationalists stop deciding for all Spaniards", "corrupt" by "workers" and "extremists" by "moderates." "We have to beat the polls, we have to overcome fear!", He emphasized.
Edmundo Bal: "You are my brothers"
Arrimadas made his speech accompanied by number four on the lists by Madrid, the former State Attorney Edmundo Bal, and his successor as leader in Catalonia, Lorena Roldán. Bal has ignited the fact that imprisoned independentist leaders have committed, in their opinion, a crime of "rebellion." In fact, his defense of this thesis led him to be dismissed from his position as a lawyer of the State for loss of confidence of the socialist executive, and his successor in charge, Rosa María Seoane, goes bet for sedition, which has finally been the crime by which political prisoners have been convicted. "They stopped me because I refused to remove the violence from the indictment, the violence that you suffered, and that is why I became your voice in Madrid," he said: "Because I refused to Sign this letter, now we are brothers. "
